intro: Coldenia aggregata, commonly known as the clustered coldenia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture. Coldenia aggregata is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories and stream banks.
